column20: We offer two months of elective rotations for our residents in their PGY3/PGY4 year. There is a one month mandatory rotation at Yale pathology department for peds/neuro/renal training. We offer one month research rotation at the West street laboratory in the PGY3/PGY4 year. Apart from the two month blood bank/transfusion medicine rotation in Danbury Hospital, the residents also receive a two week rotation at Yale Blood Bank and VA Hospital New Haven. One month OCME, Farmington, CT for PGY2.

column20: Our 4-year pathology residency program curriculum provides integrated training in anatomic and clinical pathology. Baystate Medical Center is a major academic medical center and is the regional campus of the University of Massachusetts Medical School. Our volume and breadth of interesting cases means you'll be exposed to everything you are likely to see in practice. Our faculty is very engaged in teaching and our environment is very friendly and welcoming.

column20: Our program is distinct in having a commitment to both clinical and anatomic pathology and the flexibility to customize training plans for a variety of careers. All trainees continually make successful academic progress toward independent practice. Research is emphasized and there is funding and dedicated time available for residents to participate in projects. Residents will spend time at each of 4 sites (an academic hospital, a community hospital, a private hospital, and the VA).

column20: Our program offers world class training in AP/CP, AP/NP and physician scientist pathways.  We capitalize on unparalleled learning opportunities in essentially every aspect of anatomic and clinical pathology. The program provides flexibility to meet the needs of individual residents and is proud to participate in creation of future leaders in pathology and laboratory medicine.  While our climate is frosty in the winter, our hearts are warm year-round.

column20: Our heterogeneous surgical pathology signout system has subspecialization for hematopathology, neuropathology, GI pathology, eye pathology, and dermatopathology, the rest is general signout. The Office of the Chief Medical Examiner of Boone & Callaway Counties is in our department and provides over 500 autopsy cases/year in addition to our hospital autopsies. We have a nearly 100% Board pass rate for first-time takers and an excellent record of graduates getting into fellowships.

column20: Creighton's pathology residency is based at a large, academic medical center in Omaha, Nebraska. The department handles over 1 million CP and 35,000 AP accessions annually with a broad depth of specimens. Residents are trained in one-on-one situations directly with faculty pathologists. Residents receive an annual book fund allowance and are issued an iPad which is theirs to keep. An additional travel allowance is available for poster presentations at local/regional/national conferences.

column20: The department of pathology at Dartmouth-Hitchcock offers combined anatomic and clinical pathology training. A structured four-year core curriculum encourages increasing responsibility as residents gain experience and competence. There is ample opportunity for resident research in all areas of the department. In addition to our core pathology program, the department offers accredited fellowships in cytopathology, dermatopathology, hematopathology, and blood banking/transfusion medicine.

column20: The department of pathology at the Ohio State University Wexner Medical Center is the largest quaternary care center in central Ohio offering care in all subspecialties. The program is fully accredited in anatomic and clinical pathology. In the past, the department processed: 80,000 surgical specimens, 30,000 cytology specimens, 230 autopsies, over a million chemistry specimens. There are over 85 faculty members in multiple subspecialties involved in various aspects of resident education.

column20: Our pathology residency program at the Medical University of South Carolina consists of a balanced, 40 month AP/CP core curriculum with up to 8 elective months for personalized learning. We are proud of our supportive and collaborative atmosphere within the department and campus-wide, dedicated teaching faculty, and abundant educational opportunities and resources. Our graduates have been very successful in attaining placement in choice fellowships and jobs, both locally and beyond.

column20: The department of pathology at the University of TN Medical Center Knoxville has a threefold mission: service, education, and research. The residency and new fellowship offers case volumes per year over 30,000 surgical pathology specimens, 50,000 cytology specimens, and ample clinical pathology cases. The Cancer Institute offers a spectrum of complex oncologic pathology cases. Residents obtain their choice fellowship(s) in a variety of subspecialties with most positions in private practice.

column20: The UTHSC Pathology Residency Program in Memphis, TN, is a 4-year ACGME-accredited anatomic and clinical pathology training program.  Trainees rotate at a variety of clinical settings, ranging from an academic medical center, to private practice, and a national commercial reference laboratory.  Throughout the training program, an apprenticeship model of learning is used, with graduated responsibility in the handling of a variety of cases.

column20: You are part of our pediatric family. Residency will require you to bring your best self on a daily basis, in times of success, as well as disappointment. We will not discount any of the emotions you will encounter and relish the opportunity to celebrate and support each one of you on this journey to become a pediatrician. I will always be available whenever you may need me.

column20: The PM&R residency program at Northwestern University has been a long standing program originally affiliated with the Rehabilitation Institute of Chicago (RIC). In 2017, RIC became the Shirley Ryan AbilityLab, a new state-of-the-art hospital that merges clinical care and research at the bedside of our patients. It's a unique environment for PM&R training as the space itself encourages the growth of inquisitive minds.

Our strong community based residency training program strikes an excellent balance between inpatient, outpatient, and procedural opportunities to provide an educational experience of the highest quality. Our residents are well-prepared to enter clinical practice, pursue a fellowship, or begin an academic career at the end of their broad-based training.

PM&R training covers the essential patient care areas that a Level 1 Trauma Center provides including Pediatric Rehab/Traumatic Brain Injury/Spinal Cord Injury/Stroke Rehab. Outpatient experience provides training in clinics such as interventional pain/ultrasound/EMG/NCS's/Botox/Phenol injections/Wound debridement.

column20: Our program started in 2011 and is a 3-year (1/year) independent program with an extensive clinical volume and long-standing research base. The Henry Ford Health System, since 1915, is presently anchored by a 903 bed Level 1 trauma facility with a very wide tertiary referral base for all clinical entities. Our deeply committed faculty brings many years of diverse experience to the program and is integrally involved with the development of the Henry Ford Hospital Breast Center.

column20: Residents have an annual paid travel budget to a meeting that is not required as participatory, and can opt to use some of those funds for alternative needs such as loupes, texts, etc.  The department also provides a stipend for text books.  The Department of Plastic Surgery will also cover the cost of the written board examination in plastic surgery administered by the American Board of Plastic Surgery, which will occur in the final year of the independent residency program in plastic surgery.

column20: The UF plastic surgery residency offers a diverse clinical experience inclusive of large volumes of all aspects of plastic surgery. Residents will benefit from ample opportunities in microsurgery, hand surgery, craniofacial surgery, breast reconstruction and aesthetic surgery in an academic setting with a broad, diverse patient population and state of the art facilities. The program is set in a university city with a great climate and year-round outdoor activities.
